Blog and Gallery

SCoRe published 3 posters at SENSYS 2017

Nov 16, 2017. | By: Admin

Two of our researchers Mr. Prabhash Kumarasinghe and Ms. Dilushi Piyumwardhana presented three posters at SENSYS 2017 conference based on ASSEST and D4D projects at Delft, The Netherlands on November 5-8, 2017.

[Read More]

SCoRe addressed ICTer 2017

Nov 10, 2017. | By: Admin

One of our researchers Ms. Akarshani Amarasinghe addressed ICTer 2017 conference entitled Suppressing Dengue via a Drone System at University of Colombo School of Computing, Sri Lanka.

[Read More]

SCoRe addressed DRONET 2017

Oct 7, 2017. | By: Admin

One of our heads Dr. Kasun De Zoysa addressed DRONET 2017 conference entitled Identifying Mosquito Breeding Sites via Drone Images at Niagara Falls, New York, USA on June 23, 2017.

[Read More]

SCoRe won Best Paper Award at DCOSS 2017

Oct 7, 2017. | By: Admin

SCoRe Group won the Best Paper Award for ASSEST project at DCOSS conference. Dr. Chamath Keppetiyagama presented the paper on Elephant Detection. The conference was held at Ottawa, Canada on June 5-7, 2017.

[Read More]

A New Mosquito - Rivira newspaper article

Jun 14, 2017. | By: Admin

Drone for Dengue (D4D) is a system for detecting dengue mosquito breeding sites via drone images. Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) in Sri Lanka are facing a problem of identifying certain mosquito breeding sites since they cannot easily reach places such as roof gutters, overhead water tanks, inaccessible rooftops and cement materials which are capable of retaining water.

[Read More]

A Drone Mission for Dengue - Lakbima newspaper article

Jun 13, 2017. | By: Admin

Drone for Dengue (D4D) is a system for detecting dengue mosquito breeding sites via drone images. Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) in Sri Lanka are facing a problem of identifying certain mosquito breeding sites since they cannot easily reach places such as roof gutters, overhead water tanks, inaccessible rooftops and cement materials which are capable of retaining water.

[Read More]

D4D

May 25, 2017. | By: Admin

Drone for Dengue (D4D) is a system for detecting dengue mosquito breeding sites via drone images. Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) in Sri Lanka are facing a problem of identifying certain mosquito breeding sites since they cannot easily reach places such as roof gutters, overhead water tanks, inaccessible rooftops and cement materials which are capable of retaining water.

[Read More]

SCoRe Group

May 7, 2017. | By: Admin

The Sustainable Computing Research Group (SCoRe) at UCSC has conducted research covering various aspects of wireless sensor networks, embeded systems, digital forensic, information security, mobile applications and e-learning. The goal of our research is to generate computing solutions through identifying low cost methodologies and strategies that lead to sustainability.

[Read More]

Google Code-in 2015 wrap up

Jan 26, 2016. | By: Dilushi Piumwardane, GCI mentor.

The Sustainable Computing Research Group (SCoRe) at University of Colombo School of Computing, conducts research covering various aspects of wireless sensor networks, embedded systems, digital forensic, information security, mobile applications and e-learning. The goal of our research is to generate computing solutions through identifying low cost methodologies and strategies that lead to sustainability.
